name: iotHub
description: Send messages, receive commands, and work with device twins in Azure IoT Hub.

contents.name: connect
contents.description:
Connection string typically looks something like 
`HostName=my-iot-hub.azure-devices.net;DeviceId=my-dev-007;SharedAccessKey=xyz+base64key`.
You can get it in `Shared access policies -> iothubowner -> Connection string-primary key` in the Azure Portal.

contents.name: connect
contents.description:
Connection string typically looks something like 
`HostName=my-iot-hub.azure-devices.net;DeviceId=my-dev-007;SharedAccessKey=xyz+base64key`.
You can get it in `Shared access policies -> iothubowner -> Connection string-primary key` in the Azure Portal.

contents.name: disconnect
contents.description: Disconnect from current Hub if any.

contents.name: send_string_msg
contents.description: Sends a short message in string format (it's typically JSON-encoded). Multiple properties can be attached.

contents.name: send_string_msg
contents.description: Sends a short message in string format (it's typically JSON-encoded). Multiple properties can be attached.

contents.name: send_msg_ext
contents.description: Sends an arbitrary, possibly binary, message. The size is only limited by RAM on the module.

contents.name: send_msg_ext
contents.description: Sends an arbitrary, possibly binary, message. The size is only limited by RAM on the module.

contents.name: message
contents.description: Part of the body of the message.

contents.name: properties
contents.description: Set properties on the message. Can be repeated multiple times.

contents.name: subscribe
contents.description: Subscribes for cloud to device messages, which will be sent over the specified pipe.

contents.name: sub_properties
contents.description:
If there are any properties, this meta-report is send one or more times.
All properties of a given message are always sent before the body.

contents.name: devicebound
contents.description: For every message, the body is sent once, using this report.

contents.name: get_twin
contents.description: Ask for current device digital twin.

contents.name: twin_json
contents.description:
The JSON-encoded twin; note that there can be several packets that need to be concatenated.
The pipe is closed when the last packet is sent.
This is typically something like:
`{ "desired": { "foo": 1, "$version": 12 }, "reported": { "foo": 1, "bar" 2, "$version": 123 } }`

contents.name: twin_error
contents.description: This emitted if status is not 200.

contents.name: patch_twin
contents.description: Start twin update.

contents.name: patch_twin
contents.description: Start twin update.

contents.name: twin_patch_json
contents.description:
The JSON-encoded twin update. The pipe should be closed when the last packet is sent.
You just send updates for `reported` field, like this:
`{ "bar": 3, "baz": null }` (skip `"$version"` and no `"reported": { ... }`).

contents.name: subscribe_twin
contents.description: Subscribe to updates to our twin.

contents.name: twin_update_json
contents.description: Every back-end change is sent as one or more reports like this.

contents.name: twin_update_end
contents.description: This is send after last `twin_update_json` packet for a given update.

contents.name: subscribe_method
contents.description: Subscribe to direct method calls.

contents.name: method_call_body
contents.description:
The method call body is sent using these packets.
If the body is empty, a single empty `method_call_body` is sent.

contents.name: method_call
contents.description: This is sent after the last part of the `method_call_body`.

contents.name: respond_to_method
contents.description: Respond to a direct method call (`request_id` comes from `subscribe_method` pipe).

contents.name: respond_to_method
contents.description: Respond to a direct method call (`request_id` comes from `subscribe_method` pipe).

contents.name: method_response
contents.description: The pipe should be closed when the last packet of response body is sent.

contents.name: is_connected
contents.description: Indicates whether or not we are currently connected to an IoT hub.
